summary: The Office of Gun Violence Prevention Act of 2025 proposes the establishment of an Office of Gun Violence Prevention within the Department of Justice. This office, headed by a Director appointed by the Attorney General, would coordinate gun violence prevention efforts, evaluate existing programs, recommend policy changes, collect data, and educate the public. The bill also mandates an Advisory Council composed of government officials and external experts. The office would focus on crisis response, coordination with federal agencies, and annual reporting to Congress. The overall goal is to reduce gun violence through a multi-faceted approach.
